Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device

Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Class representing device wrapper for AS_StorageDevice.

    Track prop booktype Track prop write frame size Track prop optimal frame size Track prop type Track prop record mode Track prop session number Track prop start address Track prop length Track prop recorded length Track prop append address Track prop IOState Track prop start address Track prop format types Track prop copyrighted Track prop pregap Track prop num extents Track prop start address Track prop last recorded address Track prop ISRC Track prop CDText Title Track prop CDText Performer Track prop CDText Songwriter Track prop CDText Composer Track prop CDText Arranger Track prop CDText Message Track prop CDText Genre Track prop CDText GenreCode

  • ~Device ()
    Destructor.
  • Device ()
    Finalizer.
  • delegate void EventCallback (Event_Type TypeOfEvent, System::UInt32 Device, System::IntPtr CallerUse)
    Callback delegate for receiving device event information used to alert client of device/media presence.
  • delegate System::Int32 Callback (System::IntPtr info, System::UInt32 infoDword, System::IntPtr infoPtr, System::IntPtr callerUse)
    Callback delegate for receiving progress callback info.
  • SInt32 Open (System::UInt32 index, System::String^ devicePath)
    DESCRIPTION: Sets the default device for device-related calls to the OS-provided drive index specified with the parameter index.
  • SInt32 Close ()
    DESCRIPTION: Closes the device and releases all associated memory.
  • SInt32 Copy (Device::FileFormatType format, System::UInt32 flags, System::UInt32 trackNum, System::UInt32 numDests, array< Device^ >^destList, Callback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Copies from a source to destination(s). The type of copy is specified with the "flag" parameter. NOTES: Currently only a single file format type can be specified for destination.
  • SInt32 ExclusiveAccess (ExclusiveAccessType access, String^ inAppName,[Out]String^ %outAppName)
    DESCRIPTION: Exclusive Access - get/set/query exclusive access for the device Retrieve current status with ExclusiveAccessType.Query Then, set and release with ExclusiveAccessType.Obtain and ExclusiveAccessType.Release.
  • SInt32 EraseMedia (EraseType eraseValue, Callback^ cb, System::IntPtr userData)
    DESCRIPTION: Erases the media, if any, in the specified device. The type of erase operation to perform (quick or long) is specified with the parameter erase_type. A callback with which the AuthorScript engine will report on the progress of the erasure is specified with callback. The parameter userdata allows the host application to specify a pointer to a memory location that will be passed back whenever AuthorScript calls the callback.
  • SInt32 TrayControl (TrayCtrl control)
    DESCRIPTION: Used to control operation (lock, unlock, open, close, etc.) of the media tray on this device.
  • SInt32 SetDeviceCallback (SetCallbackType access, System::UInt32 reserved, EventCallback^ eventCB, System::IntPtr userData, System::IntPtr reserved2)
    DESCRIPTION: Register for callbacks - receive a notification when a new drive arrives, or when new media arrives in a drive.
  • System::Object^ GetDeviceObjectProperty (DevProp_Type prop)
    DESCRIPTION: Generic property retrieval function to return managed Object types (System::UInt32, System::ValueType[], String, System::UInt64, etc.).
  • System::Object^ GetMediaObjectProperty (MediaProp_Type prop)
    DESCRIPTION: Generic property retrieval function to return managed Object types (System::UInt32, System::ValueType[], String, System::UInt64, etc.).
  • System::Object^ GetTrackObjectProperty (TrackProp_Type prop, System::UInt32 trackNum)
    DESCRIPTION: Generic property retrieval function to return managed Object types (System::UInt32, System::ValueType[], String, System::UInt64, etc.).
  • SInt32 SetMediaObjectProperty (MediaProp_Type prop, System::Object^ inObj)
    DESCRIPTION: Generic property setting function to set prop based on managed Object types (System::UInt32, System::ValueType[], String, System::UInt64, etc.).
  • SInt32 SetTrackObjectProperty (TrackProp_Type prop, System::UInt32 trackNum, System::Object^ inObj)
    DESCRIPTION: Generic property retrieval function to return managed Object types (System::UInt32, System::ValueType[], String, System::UInt64, etc.).

  • static const CopyFlags CopyFlagsVerifylessWrite = AS_StorageDevice::CopyFlags_VerifylessWrite
  • static const CopyFlags CopyFlagsVNR = AS_StorageDevice::CopyFlags_VNR
  • static const CopyFlags CopyFlags_QflixPro = AS_StorageDevice::CopyFlags_QflixPro
    Sonic Qflix Pro (CSS writing) is not enabled in most SDKs.
  • static const CopyFlags CopyFlags_GuardBlock = AS_StorageDevice::CopyFlags_GuardBlock
    Sonic GuardBlock (Bad block writing) is not enabled in most SDKs.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::DevProp_Type

This enumerates the properties which can be queried and/or set for the device.

Enumerator:
DevProp_Description  String OUT: string of Device Description
DevProp_MakeName  String OUT: string of Device Make name
DevProp_ModelName  String OUT: string of Device Model Name
DevProp_Version  String OUT: string of Device Version
DevProp_DrivePath  String OUT: string of Device Drive Letter
DevProp_DevType  Integer OUT: bits of the device type (Tape, Optical, File)
DevProp_MedTypesCapable  Integer OUT: bits of media types supported (DVD-RW, DVD+RW, CD-RW, CD-R, etc)
DevProp_TrayStatus  Integer OUT: TrayStatus type (UInt32)
DevProp_Bus_Info  BusData OUT: structure describes bus kind and adapter/target/lun
DevProp_AuthenTypes  Integer OUT: UInt32
DevProp_SerialNum  Byte[] OUT: UInt8[16 bytes max]
DevProp_CopyProtection  Integer OUT: bitflag of Encryption and Guardblock types supported
DevProp_MaxTransferSize  Integer OUT: size in bytes of max tranfer size of device

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::MediaProp_Type

This enumerates the properties which can be queried and/or set for the media.

Enumerator:
MedProp_Num_Sessions  Integer OUT: number of sessions
MedProp_Num_Tracks  Integer OUT: number of tracks
MedProp_Num_Layers  Integer OUT: 2 = dual layer, 1 = single layer
MedProp_MaxLayerJumpAddr  Long OUT: location of max layer jump address
MedProp_State  Integer OUT: State of media (writable, write-protected, etc).
MedProp_Bytes_Used  Long OUT: Media space used in bytes
MedProp_Bytes_Free  Long OUT: Media Capacity information
MedProp_Manufacturer  Byte[] OUT: Media manufacturer ID from disc
MedProp_CurRead_DataRates  Integer IN/OUT: KBps for the current read speed
MedProp_CurWrite_DataRates  Integer OUT: KBps for the current write speed
MedProp_WriteList_DataRates  Integer[] OUT: The list of UInt32s of Write Data rates
MedProp_Kind  Long OUT: DVD-RW, DVD+RW, CD-RW, CD-R, etc
MedProp_FileFormat  Integer IN/OUT: File Device format type
MedProp_LayerJumpAddr  Long IN/OUT: location of layer jump address
MedProp_MinLayerJumpAddr  Long OUT: location of min layer jump address
MedProp_BookType  Integer IN/OUT: media booktype set and retrieval
MedProp_CurRead_Hundredth_X  Integer IN/OUT: 1/100ths X for current read speed
MedProp_CurWrite_Hundredth_X  Integer OUT: 1/100ths X for current write speed
MedProp_WriteList_Hundredth_X  Integer[] OUT: The list of UInt32s of Data rates in 1/100ths X
MedProp_CDText_MediaCatalogNum  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Media Catalog number
MedProp_CDText_Title  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Title
MedProp_CDText_Performer  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Performer
MedProp_CDText_Songwriter  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Songwriter
MedProp_CDText_Composer  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Composer
MedProp_CDText_Arranger  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Arranger
MedProp_CDText_Message  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Message
MedProp_CDText_Genre  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Genre
MedProp_CDText_Genre_Code  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Genre Code
MedProp_CDText_NumLanguages  Integer IN/OUT: number of languages with CDText on this media
MedProp_CDText_Languages  Integer[] IN/OUT: array of languages with CDText
MedProp_CurAuthenType  Integer IN: get the authentication type of the media
MedProp_CopyProtection  Integer OUT: bitflag of ProtectionType supported by this media.
MedProp_TestWrite  Integer IN/OUT: Testwrite enabled (1) / disabled (0) - (reports invalid media if no media support).

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::TrackProp_Type

This enumerates the properties which can be queried and/or set for the tracks on media.

Enumerator:
TrackProp_BlockSize  Integer IN/OUT: blocksize in bytes (only tape can select new blocksize)
TrackProp_WriteFrameSize  Integer IN/OUT: frame size for write
TrackProp_OptimalFrameSize  Integer IN/OUT: optimal frame size for write
TrackProp_TrkType  TrackProp_TrackType IN/OUT: type of track (audio, data, data Mode2, blank)
TrackProp_RecordMode  TrackProp_RecordMode_Type IN/OUT: recording mode
TrackProp_SessionNum  Integer IN/OUT: session number
TrackProp_StartAddr  Integer IN/OUT: start address of track
TrackProp_Length  Integer IN/OUT: length of track
TrackProp_RecLength  Integer IN/OUT: recorded length of track
TrackProp_AppendAddr  Integer IN/OUT: append address of track
TrackProp_State  TrackProp_IOState IN/OUT: state of track
TrackProp_CurFormatType  Integer IN/OUT: currently formatted type of track
TrackProp_FormatTypes  Integer[] IN/OUT: format types for tracks
TrackProp_Copyrighted  Integer IN/OUT: copyrighted
TrackProp_Pregap  Integer IN/OUT: size of pregap (in blocks)
TrackProp_ISRC  String IN/OUT: string of CDText ISRC
TrackProp_CDText_Title  String IN/OUT: string of CDText title
TrackProp_CDText_Performer  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Performer
TrackProp_CDText_Songwriter  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Songwriter
TrackProp_CDText_Composer  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Composer
TrackProp_CDText_Arranger  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Arranger
TrackProp_CDText_Message  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Message
TrackProp_NumExtents  UInt32 IN/OUT: number of extents in track
TrackProp_Postgap  UInt32 IN/OUT: size of postgap (in blocks)
TrackProp_CDText_Genre  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Genre
TrackProp_CDText_GenreCode  String IN/OUT: string of CDText Genre Code
TrackProp_LastRecAddr  UInt32 IN/OUT: last recorded address

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::TrayCtrl

Enumeration of Tray control operations for TrayControl function.

Enumerator:
Unlock  prevent tray from moving
Open  allow tray to be ejected/inserted

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::Event_Type

Enumeration of event types returned to caller for device/media arrival/departure.

Enumerator:
EventMediaRemoval  media disappeared
EventMediaArrival  new media or changed media is ready
EventDeviceArrival  drive appeared
EventDeviceRemoval  drive disappeared

enum Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::Info

Enumeration of progress types returned to caller.

Enumerator:
ProgressUpdate  infoDword = percent complete, infoPtr = Progress structure
PromptForMediaInDevice  infoDword = unused, infoPtr = unused

)

Device  Handle to device in which the event occurred.
CallerUse  Caller gets their IntPtr back that they registered with.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::Open ( System::UInt32  index,
System::String^   devicePath 
)

DESCRIPTION: Sets the default device for device-related calls to the OS-provided drive index specified with the parameter index.

A device object is created for the device used is to specify the device in subsequent device-related calls. NOTE:
This function must be called before any other device-related calls. EXAMPLES:
There are 3 types of usage for Device constructor: physical devices, file devices, and virtual devices Here is an example call for each:
Physical device:
Device(DeviceIndex, "");
File device:
Device(0, FileName);
Virtual device:
Device(0, "");

Parameters:
[in] index - OS provided drive index (must be less than count output by GetCount
[in] devicePath - Optional path for file or virtual device
Returns:
StorageError_None - ok

StorageError_InvalidIndex - if the index provided is greater than the count provifed by AS_GetStorageDeviceCount

StorageError_Fatal - failed to create a list of valid drives

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::Close (  ) 

DESCRIPTION: Closes the device and releases all associated memory.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - device handle is invalid.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::Copy ( Device::FileFormatType  format,
System::UInt32  flags,
System::UInt32  trackNum,
System::UInt32  numDests,
array< Device^ >^  destList,
Callback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Copies from a source to destination(s). The type of copy is specified with the "flag" parameter. NOTES: Currently only a single file format type can be specified for destination.

Parameters:
[in] format - Type of format based on constant
See also:
Device.FileFormatType
Parameters:
[in] flags - flag to control copy behavior based on consts for Device.CopyFlags
[in] trackNum - Optional flag to copy only certain tracks
[in] numDests - Number of destinations in list
[in] destList - array of Device objects
[in] cb - callback for progress notifications
[in] userData - user provided info
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - invalid drive handle

StorageError.DeviceError - the device reported an error

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::ExclusiveAccess ( ExclusiveAccessType  access,
String^   inAppName,
[Out] String^ %  outAppName 
)

DESCRIPTION: Exclusive Access - get/set/query exclusive access for the device Retrieve current status with ExclusiveAccessType.Query Then, set and release with ExclusiveAccessType.Obtain and ExclusiveAccessType.Release.

Parameters:
[in] access - type of access to get/set/query
See also:
Device.ExclusiveAccessType
Parameters:
[in] inAppName - String of the application's name to set (only valid when access = Device.ExclusiveAccessType.Obtain
[out] outAppName - String of the application currently using device (only valid when access = Query and device is in use)
NOTE: StorageError.DeviceError = failed (if the drive is already in use when trying to obtain) Out param might not be supported by all languages

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.DeviceInUse - if the drive is already in use when trying to obtain

StorageError.InvalidParameter - invalid drive handle or invalid access_type flag

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::EraseMedia ( EraseType  eraseValue,
Callback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
)

DESCRIPTION: Erases the media, if any, in the specified device. The type of erase operation to perform (quick or long) is specified with the parameter erase_type. A callback with which the AuthorScript engine will report on the progress of the erasure is specified with callback. The parameter userdata allows the host application to specify a pointer to a memory location that will be passed back whenever AuthorScript calls the callback.

NOTES: The device state must be ready (see AS_StorageDevice_GetState). An error will result if the device is currently in use by an AuthorScript Imaging project.

Parameters:
[in] eraseValue - value signifying type of erase to perform
See also:
Device.EraseType
Parameters:
[in] cb - callback for progress notifications
[in] userData - user provided info
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - invalid drive handle

StorageError.DeviceError - the device reported an error

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::TrayControl ( TrayCtrl  control  ) 

DESCRIPTION: Used to control operation (lock, unlock, open, close, etc.) of the media tray on this device.

NOTE: An error will result if the device is currently in use.

Parameters:
[in] control - operation of the media tray on this device
See also:
Device.TrayCtrl
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.DeviceError - the device reported an error.

StorageError.InvalidParameter - the device handle provided is invalid.

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Device::SetDeviceCallback ( SetCallbackType  access,
System::UInt32  reserved,
EventCallback^   eventCB,
System::IntPtr  userData,
System::IntPtr  reserved2 
)

DESCRIPTION: Register for callbacks - receive a notification when a new drive arrives, or when new media arrives in a drive.

NOTE: Current drive which has been exclusively obtained will not report media notification

Parameters:
[in] access - register or unregister callbacks
See also:
Device.SetCallbackType
Parameters:
[in] reserved - reserved field for future
[in] eventCB - callback for progress notifications
[in] userData - user provided info
[in] reserved2 - reserved field for future
Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - device handle is invalid or invalid Callback flag

StorageError.Fatal - failed to create a list of valid drives
